data.title: Construyen en India una Diosa gigante de bambú
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) RESTRICTION SUMMARY: 
STORYLINE: 
Para crear esta escultura de la deidad hindú Durga, el artista musulmán Nuruddin Ahmed requirió la ayuda de 60 artesanos.
En agosto, empezó la labor para levantar la estatua hecha totalmente con bambú.
Cuando casi la habían terminado, una tormenta acabó con la figura de la diosa Durga, una de las más de 200 que Ahmed ha hecho desde 1975.
Pero el equipo consiguió recuperar este gigante de más de 30 metros.
NAT –Nuruddin Ahmed, artista
El artista asegura que su iniciativa busca promover el uso del bambú local. En total, utilizaron 5.000 cañas de esa especie.
Considerada la madre del uinverso, Durga es venerada por su generosidad e imponente poder.
Por sus dimensiones, esta representación de Durga fue medida por el gobierno para meterla en competición para entrar al libro Guiness de los récords como la escultura de bambú más alta de la historia.
Los vecinos están tan orgullosos como impresionados por el trabajo de Ahmed y su iniciativa ecológica.
NAT – Shantasri Mazumdar, residente de Gauhati
"It's really..."
"Es realmente un gran logro para nosotros y muy importante para la ciudad de Gauhati... es realmente un gran trabajo", dice esta mujer.
Ahmed decidió crear esta Durga de bambú para el festival que se celebra cada año en honor a esta diosa. Las calles de la ciudad se llenan de estatuas que la representan y los devotos la adoran y rezan por ella.
Alba Tobella, Associated Press
===SOURCE: AP===
AP CLIENTS ONLY
===========================================================
Clients are reminded: 
(i) to check the terms of their licence agreements for use of content outside news programming and that further advice and assistance can be obtained from the AP Archive on: Tel +44 (0) 20 7482 7482 Email: info@aparchive.com

data.title: Most of US Embassy Staff Leaving Cuba
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) The United States on Friday abruptly warned Americans not to visit Cuba and ordered more than half its Havana embassy personnel to leave the island in a dramatic response to mysterious recent "specific attacks" harming the health of U.S. diplomats.
The actions deal a blow to already delicate ties between the U.S. and Cuba, longtime adversaries who only recently began putting their hostility behind them. 
The embassy in Havana will lose roughly 60 percent of its U.S. staff, and will stop processing visas in Cuba indefinitely, officials said. 
Roughly 50 Americans are currently working at the embassy in Havana.
Associated Press reporter Josh Lederman has been following this story from the State Department.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/40d6109a7a3725e64223e975ada55abc 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Florida governor offers help to Puerto Rico
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) Florida Governor Rick Scott said he is willing to help Puerto Rico in whatever way he and his state can following the devastation from Hurricane Maria. 
"We've told them, whatever their needs are, we're going to be there," he said. 
Scott made the comments after meeting with President Trump at the White House, where they discussed recovery efforts in Florida from Hurricane Irma and what needs to be done in Puerto Rico.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/671b55810628913f082c79dd8e5603f2 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: The folk song sung for aliens in space
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) COMMERCIAL MUSIC, MUSIC VIDEO AND OR PERFORMANCES, MUST BE CLEARED ACCORDING TO YOUR OWN LOCAL MUSIC PERFORMANCE AND COPYRIGHT AGREEMENTS WITH YOUR APPLICABLE COLLECTING SOCIETY.  
GEORGIA VOYAGER SONG 
SOURCE: ASSOCIATED PRESS/NASA
RESTRICTIONS: AP CLIENTS ONLY
LENGTH: 6:07

ASSOCIATED PRESS
Tbilisi, Georgia - September 28, 2017
++16:9++
1. Various of Folk Ensemble Erisioni performing song 'Chakrulo' which was sent into the time capsule on Voyager 1
2. Mid of John Casani, Voyager Mission Manager, listening 
3. Wide of stage, Rostom Saginashvili, singer who sang 'Chakrulo' Voyager version 
4. Close of Rostom Saginashvili
5. Mid of John Casani greeting Rostom Saginashvili 
6. Mid of John Casani presenting Rostom Saginashvili with copy of gold disc sent on Voyager
7. Close of gold disc
8. Mid of Rostom Songulashvili and his grandson looking at gold disk
9. Close of track listing on disc, song listed no 6. 'Chakrulo'
10. SOUNDBITE (Georgian) Rostom Saginashvili, Singer:
"We did not know anything about the recording. Only years after we were told that our recording was sent to space."
11. Close of gold disc 
12. SOUNDBITE (English) Ian Kelly, U.S. ambassador to Georgia:
"An aspect of this which I think is very touching and resonant with Georgians is one of their polyphonic folk songs, 'Chakrulo', was chosen by Carl Sagan to be one of the emblematic pieces of music, of culture, of culture of man. It was the only song from this part of the world, the only song from the former Soviet Union. And it just is I think very emblematic of how special Georgian culture is. We were thrilled that it was recognised forty years ago and put on this what is now an interstellar space craft to go out into space."
ASSOCIATED PRESS
Cape Canaveral, Florida, US - 5 September 1977
++4:3/MUTE++
13. Launch of Voyager One, NASA's first probe to fly beyond our solar system
ASSOCIATED PRESS
Tbilisi, Georgia - September 28, 2017
++16:9++
14. SOUNDBITE (English) John Casani, Voyager Mission Manager:
"2012, Voyager 1 actually penetrated the boundary between our solar system and outer planet space space and it's now among the stars and it's gonna continue on that trajectory forever." 
NASA
Cape Canaveral, Florida, US - 21 November 1980
++16:9++
++4:3/MUTE++
15. Various of Earth darkening as moon passes between Earth and the Sun, as seen by Voyager probe
ASSOCIATED PRESS
Cape Canaveral, Florida, US - 30 October 1980
++4:3/MUTE++
16. Animation showing trajectory of Voyager 1 towards Saturn
ASSOCIATED PRESS
Tbilisi, Georgia - September 28, 2017
++16:9++
17. SOUNDBITE (English) John Casani, Voyager mission manager:
"So, we tried to give a full picture of the Earth. One important thing was the voices of people. So, we had recordings, greetings of the people or whoever will be out there, come and visit us some day in 125 different languages and we also wanted to put some music because that conveys culture and shows the soul of people is represented by music."
NASA
Cape Canaveral, Florida, US - 30 October 1980
++4:3/MUTE++
18. Zoom into animation of Voyager 1 
ASSOCIATED PRESS
Tbilisi, Georgia - September 28, 2017
++16:9++
19. SOUNDBITE (English) Rob Manning, NASA Flight System Chief Engineer:
20. Mid of Folk Ensemble Erisioni performing song 'Chakrulo' 
21. Mid of audience applauding, zoom in to John Casani
22. Wide of Tbilisi Opera House exterior
LEADIN : 
This year marks the 40th anniversary of NASA's launch of the Voyager probes to explore Jupiter and Saturn. 
Each carries an identical 12-inch, gold-plated copper phonograph record (there were no CDs or MP3s back then) containing messages from Earth: Beethoven's Fifth, chirping crickets, a baby's cry, a kiss, wind and rain and many more. 
STORYLINE: 


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/b6c2b066fb1fcca6b431b362fb0a1c81 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: El dinero empieza a escasear en un Puerto Rico devastado
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) RESTRICTION SUMMARY: 
STORYLINE: 
Primero, el huracán María dejó a Puerto Rico sin agua corriente ni electricidad. Después empezaron a acabarse el combustible y el agua. Ahora es el dinero. 
La poderosa tormenta prácticamente ha creado una parálisis en la economía del territorio estadounidense que podría durar semanas, y mucha gente se está quedando sin efectivo y teme que sobrevivir se haga aún más difícil en la devastada isla. 
Hay largas filas ante los bancos que abren con horario limitado y ante los pocos cajeros automáticos que funcionan, en medio de un apagón generalizado y de un corte casi total en las telecomunicaciones. 
SOUNDBITE - Raúl Santiago, Usuario de banco
"Vine preparado mentalmente a eso (La fila del banco) para tener un poco de efectivo encima, porque casi como  a todos los sitios que uno va comprar no hay sistema tiene
SOUNDBITE - Sergio Rosado, Usuario de banco
"Hoy en día en todo sitio hay que hacer fila, no puede ser impaciente uno, hay que esperar con calma, que todo sea con calma"
Puerto Rico ya tenía problemas antes de la tormenta. La isla lleva más de una década en recesión, la tasa de pobreza era del 45% y el desempleo rondaba el 10%, más alto que en ningún estado de Estados Unidos. 
===SOURCE: AP===
===========================================================
Clients are reminded: 
(i) to check the terms of their licence agreements for use of content outside news programming and that further advice and assistance can be obtained from the AP Archive on: Tel +44 (0) 20 7482 7482 Email: info@aparchive.com
(ii) they should check with the applicable collecting society in their Territory regarding the clearance of any sound recording or performance included within the AP Television News service

data.title: Puerto Ricans Brave Long Lines to Withdraw Cash
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) Many Puerto Ricans in San Juan took a deep breath and began the necessary process of waiting in long queues in the hopes of getting some cash from their banks.
With the electrical grid wrecked across the island, ATM machines are unusable and monetary transactions are all having to be done with cash. All bank transactions are being done by hand which makes the process of withdrawing money a lengthy one.
People in the queues expressed the need for calm given the circumstances. 
Hurricane Maria devastated the US territory of 3.4 (m) million last week, destroying homes and businesses. It is blamed for 16 deaths on the island.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/9a8702675c5a0162ac853e1b5d3a42d0 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: NYC Food Bank Ships 20,000 Meals to Puerto Rico
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) The Food Bank For New York is shipping 26 pallets of food and supplies to Puerto Rico to help recovery efforts after Hurricane Maria devastated the island last week.
"Today's truck held about 20,000 meals," Margarette Purvis, CEO of the Food Bank For New York City.
The meals consisted of peanut butter, cereal and diapers.
Purvis urged people wishing to donate not to send clothes.
"We need meals that are ready to eat," Purvis said, "that do not require heating, so things like tuna, peanut butter just things that you can eat right away." 
The supplies are being sent directly to Puerto Rico for distribution by Banco de Alimentos de Puerto Rico, a sister organisation on the island, to be distributed to victims of Hurricane Maria.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/8f28a0d0729c83ffcdaf4be269095368 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Death toll of Mexico earthquake now stands at 355
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) The death toll from the 19 September earthquake in central Mexico stood at 355 on Friday, 214 of those in Mexico City. 
Across the capital at sites where buildings and homes collapsed, Mexicans were showing their appreciation and respect for the efforts that have been made by first responders and search teams.
A scant 100 metres from what's left of an office building in Colonia Roma Norte, the only site where rescue and recovery activity can be still be seen, neighbours and passerby's alike write on a makeshift billboard expressing there support. 
One resident spoke of how the whole community pitched in to help when they learned of the collapse. 
The earthquake also caused fatalities in the states of Morelos, Puebla, Mexico State, Guerrero and Oaxaca.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/c738747feed9a819fe9f57f5b58ce6c1 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Referendum: Spanish school occupied by parents, pupils
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) A school in Barcelona has decided to stay open over the weekend as part of a protest against the Spanish government's ruling that a referendum on Catalonian independence cannot go ahead.
The school will be used as a voting centre in a referendum that has been declared illegal by Madrid.
"So given the recent events the school community has decided to stand up and to defend the democratic values that kids need to learn," said David Martinez, who has three children at the school.
People arrived at the school on Friday carrying suitcases and sleeping matresses to spend the coming days occupying the school, Escola Univers located in the Eixample district of the city. 
There is a threat that the school may be forceably evacuated by the police.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/cbcbb3d17c289d7a4516cd82985e67ed 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Pro-Brexit UK Independence Party names new leader
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) The weakened UK Independence Party on Friday announced that former Army officer Henry Bolton will be its fourth leader in just over one year.
Anne Marie Waters, an openly anti-Islam candidate who had divided the party, finished second in the leadership contest. 
She leads a group called Sharia Watch UK that characterizes the spread of Islam as a threat to Britain.
Bolton said after his unexpected victory that securing Britain's rapid exit from the European Union is the party's "core task." 
He said Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative government had so far failed to deliver on the Brexit mandate that voters wanted.
Britain and the European Union are currently negotiating the terms of their divorce.
"We want the right to self-determination," Bolton said, calling for an end to decisions affecting Britain being made in a foreign capital.
Bolton is expected to give his first major speech at the party conference on Saturday.
UKIP has struggled since achieving its aim of winning public support in a 2016 referendum to leave the European Union. 
It scored less than 2 percent of the votes in Britain's June election and holds no seats in the British Parliament despite having some representation in the European Parliament.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/8c0996199eacaf63cabe2919e2d9e01b 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Trump defends Puerto Rico response, comments on Cuba
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) US President Donald Trump defended his administration's response to the devastation in Puerto Rico on Friday following Hurricane Maria. 
"We have done an incredible job considering there's absolutely nothing to work with," Trump said.  
Trump has received criticism for acting slowly to send help to the US territory. 
The president  also said some "very bad things" happened to American diplomats who were harmed by unexplained health "attacks" in Cuba.
He offered his first public comments on the attacks that have harmed at least 21 American diplomats and their families.
Earlier on Friday, the State Department announced it was pulling more than half its diplomats out of Havana.
Trump said there was a "big problem" in Cuba.
He said "they did some very bad things." 
But he did not specify who he believes is responsible.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/4c42842207b81db159358186b1216ca9 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Gay couple counts days to get married ahead of Germany law change
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) Gay couples living in Germany prepared to welcome a long-awaited law legalizing same-sex marriage, which comes into effect on Sunday.
The law brings Germany in line with many of its Western peers.
Bodo Mende and Karl Kreile, both born in 1957, and living and working as civil servants in Berlin, met on 14 July in 1979.  
Now they are counting the days to finally get married on Sunday morning.
"We no longer have a second-class partnership, but finally have a partnership equal to all the other heterosexual partnerships, which are working just as good or just as bad as homosexual partnerships," said Bodo Mende.
Germany has allowed same-sex couples to enter civil partnerships since 2001, but had not granted them full marital rights, which include the possibility to jointly adopt children. 
Chancellor Angela Merkel voted against the measure, but paved the way for its passage by allowing members of her conservative party to vote according to their conscience.
Lawmakers voted 393-226 to legalize "marriage for everybody," with four abstentions.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/2f95ff6b6d6da33862a86509f69de549 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: ¿A quién salvó Frida, la heroína de los perros rescatistas?
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) RESTRICTION SUMMARY: 
STORYLINE: 
Esta perrita llamada Frida se ve como una mascota cualquiera, pero es toda una estrella. Lo que pasa es que se dedica a salvar vidas.
La coqueta labradora retriever es, junto con dos pastores belga malinois, parte de la unidad canina de la Secretaría de Marina de México y desde el 19 de septiembre los tres han buscado sobrevivientes del terremoto de 7,1 grados que sacudió el centro del país y dejó más de 340 fallecidos. 
SOUNDBITE - Alberto Emanuel Hernandez Mares, entrenador de Friday
Luego de este sismo, no halló ningún cuerpo, pero eso es lo de menos. 
En medio de una de las peores tragedias en la historia reciente de México, Frida de ocho años de edad, pasó de ser sólo un perro rescatista de las fuerzas armadas mexicanas a un símbolo de esperanza nacional. 
===SOURCE: AP===
===========================================================

data.title: Trump Vows A 'Giant, Beautiful, Massive' Tax Cut
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) U.S. President Donald Trump is promoting his plan for a sweeping rewrite of the tax code to an audience eager for the proposed change.
Trump addressed the National Association of Manufacturers on Friday in Washington, saying he's working hard to help companies thrive, compete and grow.
Key to that, he says, is a "giant, beautiful, massive, the biggest ever in our country tax cut."
The president and congressional Republicans this week released the outlines of a nearly 6 (t) trillion US dollars  tax cut plan.
The plan would deeply reduce taxes for corporations, and simplify tax brackets and nearly double the standard deduction used by most tax filers. Many details remain to be fleshed out, however.
Trump says he's working to level the playing field for American workers to they can better compete with workers around the world.
Trump wants to sign tax legislation into law by the end of the year.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/063840f815697e0e3891c348b0c3b0bc 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Most of US Embassy Staff Leaving Cuba
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) The United States on Friday abruptly warned Americans not to visit Cuba and ordered more than half its Havana embassy personnel to leave the island in a dramatic response to mysterious recent "specific attacks" harming the health of U.S. diplomats.
The actions deal a blow to already delicate ties between the U.S. and Cuba, longtime adversaries who only recently began putting their hostility behind them. 
The embassy in Havana will lose roughly 60 percent of its U.S. staff, and will stop processing visas in Cuba indefinitely, officials said. 
Roughly 50 Americans are currently working at the embassy in Havana.
Associated Press Foreign Policy reporter Josh Lederman has been following the story.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/db479c57eefb32a3937da8d0a19fd47c 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Duke Travels to Puerto Rico to Survey Damage
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) The Acting Secretary of Homeland Security, Elaine Duke, flew to Puerto Rico to conduct an assessment of the situation there Friday.
Travelling with a team of experts Duke said she was "proud of the people of Puerto Rico for being so resilient after these two terrible hurricanes" and that "public servants in the United States and the government of Puerto Rico are working together.
Duke made the comments upon landing in San Juan. She drew a sharp rebuke from the city's mayor for saying Thursday that the federal relief effort is "a good news story."
 Maria devastated the U.S territory of 3.4 million last week, destroying homes and businesses. It is blamed for 16 deaths on the island.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/cabf51224bf9b8d28021c7e7a3933ce1 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork

data.title: Entierros musicales en Ghana para aliviar el dolor
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) RESTRICTION SUMMARY: 
STORYLINE: 
Benjamin Aidoo empezó a transportar ataúdes para pagarse la escuela. Ahora, diez años después, lo que empezó como un experimento se ha convertido en una empresa de unos cien empleados: acompañan a los muertos a la tumba, pero con música y bailes. 
Su estilo es cada vez más copiado en Ghana.
NAT – Benjamin Aidoo, jefe de la empresa Otafrija
"Nosotros siempre mejoramos nuestras coreografías, traemos nuevos estilos para adaptarnos a los clientes para que sepan que somos únicos", dice... "el cielo es mi límite, pero tengo que ir más allá", es su lema.
(LOCATION: Accra, Ghana)
Con este tipo de celebraciones, la gente ha empezado a ver los funerales como una ocasión para reunirse con la familia y celebrar al muerto, más que llorar por él.
(LOCATION: Prampram, Ghana)
Al principio, estos enterradores vestían de negro, como lo han hecho tradicionalmente en su país y en gran parte del mundo. Pero con el tiempo, Aidoo empezó a incluir colores en su propia vestimenta y a comprar sus propios trajes y zapatos.
Ahora, atiende media docena de entierros a la semana. Los costos dependen del número de empleados que necesite y de los trajes que usan, pero oscilan entre los 180 y los 270 dólares.
NAT – Anabelle Namartey, nieta de un fallecido
"Este es el máximo tributo que podemos pagar por enterrar a alguien", dice esta mujer, que cree que debería ser más habitual despedir a los muertos con una celebración después de todo el tiempo que han pasado en la tierra.
Pero no todos están de acuerdo con romper la solemnidad.
NAT – Gabriel Maurice Martey, sobrino de un fallecido
Este hombre opina que este tipo de ceremonia no tiene nada que ver con las tradiciones de su país, ni en términos religiosos ni históricos.
Pero a Benjamin Aidoo no le afectan las críticas, él se limita a intentar hacer de un momento amargo, uno un poco más feliz.
Alba Tobella, Associated Press
=== SOURCE: AP===
===========================================================
Clients are reminded: 
(i) to check the terms of their licence agreements for use of content outside news programming and that further advice and assistance can be obtained from the AP Archive on: Tel +44 (0) 20 7482 7482 Email: info@aparchive.com
(ii) they should check with the applicable collecting society in their Territory regarding the clearance of any sound recording or performance included within the AP Television News service 
(iii) they have editorial responsibility for the use of all and any content included within the AP Television News service and for libel, privacy, compliance and third party rights applicable to their Territory.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/eb689669a03aa7aba2aa02dd3548fa99

data.title: Florida governor offers help to Puerto Rico
data.description:
(29 Sep 2017) Florida Governor Rick Scott said he is willing to help Puerto Rico in whatever way he and his state can following the devastation from Hurricane Maria. 
"We've told them, whatever their needs are, we're going to be there," he said. 
Scott made the comments after meeting with President Trump at the White House, where they discussed recovery efforts in Florida from Hurricane Irma and what needs to be done in Puerto Rico.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/671b55810628913f082c79dd8e5603f2 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
